俄罗斯设计师和品牌正在帮助零售业从 15 个月的动荡商店关闭和需求下滑中逐渐复苏，新品牌填补了外国竞争对手和购物者暂时回归留下的缺口。

数百家外国零售商因俄罗斯于 2022 年 2 月向乌克兰派遣军队而关门歇业，导致莫斯科一些最负盛名的街道上的商店被用木板封死，整个行业遭受了约 25 亿美元的打击。

西班牙的 Inditex (ITX.MC)已将其 500 多家俄罗斯商店中的一部分出售给阿联酋的买家。其位于莫斯科市中心的 Zara 旗舰店闲置了一年多，上个月在新管理层和新品牌 MAAG 的带领下重新开业，令顾客大体满意。

莫斯科居民安东在店外对路透社说：“自从你知道谁来了之后，一切似乎都没有改变。”

同为莫斯科人的安东尼娜说：“除了选择的多样性，我没有发现任何不同之处。目前一切都比较少。”

金钱万能

俄罗斯购物中心委员会主席 Oleg Klimov 表示，零售额是衡量消费者需求的一个关键指标，在 2022 年下滑，受通货膨胀率飙升和工资下降的打击，而西方人口外流导致重工业损失，并担心物流和支付问题需要几个月才能解决。

“一般人只是不明白发生了什么，”他告诉路透社。 “他们不想花钱。损失约为 2000 亿卢布（24.7 亿美元）。

“但它现在正在恢复，”他补充说。 “钱总是最终会易手。”

俄罗斯人获得西方产品的机会正在减少，例如麦当劳汉堡和李维斯牛仔裤——苏联解体后资本主义可以提供的那种自由的象征。

Gloria Jeans 曾经是 Levi's 牛仔裤的转售商，现在已经接管了瑞典零售商 H&M 在莫斯科的中央商店。

西方对俄罗斯的回避，以及出口禁令和惩罚性制裁，使贸易路线复杂化。

“最大的问题是国际交易，”Ksenia Zhdanova 说，她经营着自己的 KSEW 服装品牌，并且是在线俄罗斯设计师服装市场 Richmill 的商业总监。

“我们的行业极度依赖进口。”

Zhdanova 说，另一个问题是员工短缺，她认为只有政府主导的举措才能解决纺织品裁缝和专业人员的短缺问题。

俄罗斯人已经开发出小规模进口和在线卖家的解决方案，帮助外国品牌保持活力，但有些东西仍然很难找到。

购物者 Irina Nikulina 表示，她并不太想念外国品牌，除非需要一些简单的东西，比如价格合理的白色 T 恤。

Tatiana Vakhonina 说她最想念瑞典家具巨头宜家和 Zara。

“我们现在去哈萨克斯坦购物，”她说。 “但有些东西你根本买不到了。”

一名苏丹外交消息人士称，苏丹军队周三暂停了与敌对准军事部队就停火和允许人道主义准入进行的会谈，这引发了人们对这场持续六周多的冲突会出现新的流血事件的担忧。

与快速支援部队 (RSF) 的谈判于 5 月初开始，产生了保护平民的承诺宣言和两项短期停火协议，尽管这些协议一再遭到违反。

直到周二晚些时候，居民们报告说喀土穆南部和尼罗河对岸的恩图曼发生了激烈冲突。

依靠空中力量和大炮的军队，以及武装力量较轻但在喀土穆巷战中是强敌的快速支援部队已同意在周一到期前将为期一周的停火协议延长五天。

自 4 月 15 日以来，职业军官、陆军总司令阿卜杜勒·法塔赫·布尔汉和前民兵组织指挥官穆罕默德·哈姆丹·达加洛上将陷入权力争夺战。双方似乎都没有优势。

RSF 在周二晚些时候的一份声明中表示，尽管军队“一再违反”，它仍致力于停火。

在续签停火协议之前，一名军方消息人士称，军方已要求 RSF 撤出平民住宅和医院，以此作为延期的条件。在同意延长五天后，继续就休战条款进行谈判。

休战协议是在斡旋下达成的，并受到沙特阿拉伯和美国的远程监控。他们说双方都违反了它，但仍然允许向大约 200 万人提供援助。

战争已造成数百人死亡，近 140 万人逃离家园，其中超过 35 万人前往邻国。

喀土穆和首都地区一直是战斗最激烈的地方，尽管其他地区也爆发了冲突，包括苏丹最西部的达尔富尔地区。

首都经历了广泛的抢劫和频繁的断电断水。大多数医院已经停止运作。

联合国、一些援助机构、大使馆和苏丹中央政府的部分部门已将业务转移到苏丹港，这是红海的主要航运枢纽，几乎没有动荡。

自前总统奥马尔·巴希尔 (Omar al-Bashir) 于 2019 年被推翻以来，军队和无国界支援部队 (RSF) 的领导人从政府用来平息早些时候达尔富尔起义的民兵中脱颖而出，在苏丹执政委员会中担任要职。

巴希尔在一场民众起义中被推翻后，军队和无国界支援部队领导人在 2021 年将领导权交给平民之前发动了政变。在计划的交接下，他们在 RSF 的指挥系统和重组问题上发生了争执。

他是“先驱”、“马大哥”，有人希望他当美国总统。亿万富翁埃隆马斯克在中国之行期间受到了中国公众的一致好评，同时还获得了三位政府部长的接见。

自周二抵达北京以来，这位特斯拉公司(TSLA.O)的首席执行官会见了中国外交部、商务和工业部长，并与顶级电池供应商宁德时代(300750.SZ)董事长曾毓群共进晚餐。

尽管对这些讨论知之甚少——工信部仅表示马斯克与其负责人金壮龙就电动汽车和联网汽车的发展交换了意见——但这并没有阻止中国社交媒体上对马斯克的热情高涨。

“他是全球偶像，”一位用户评论道。 “埃隆·马斯克真是太棒了，要是中国能有埃隆·马斯克这样的人就好了，”另一位说。

自中国取消其零 COVID 政策并重新开放边境以来，马斯克的暗访是美国主要首席执行官对中国的最新一次访问。苹果(AAPL.O)的蒂姆库克 3 月份访问了中国，而摩根大通(JPM.N)的杰米戴蒙和星巴克(SBUX.O)的拉克斯曼纳拉西姆汉本周也在中国。

但与对同行的低调欢迎相比，马斯克的访问是一个热门话题，尽管美中紧张局势加剧，但他对人工智能和电动汽车的评论表现出浓厚的兴趣。

社交媒体上发布的照片​​显示，就连周二晚上他与 CATL 的曾庆红在高档满福宴餐厅分享的 16 道菜的菜单也是热情洋溢。

菜单上有两匹正在饲养的骏马——马斯克中文名字中“马”字的游戏——菜单将特斯拉描述为“从传统汽车公司中脱颖而出”的黑马。

与中国的社交媒体风暴和他在国内在 Twitter（他现在拥有）上掀起波澜的倾向形成鲜明对比的是，马斯克在他的行程中尚未发表任何公开声明。推特在中国被屏蔽。

特斯拉和宁德时代没有回应置评请求。商务部也没有回应置评请求。外交部援引这位亿万富翁的话说，美国和中国经济是“连体双胞胎”，并表示他反对两国脱钩。

马斯克三年来首次访问中国之际，特斯拉正面临来自中国制造电动汽车的日益激烈的竞争，而且上海工厂的扩张计划存在一些不确定性。

该工厂去年生产了超过 700,000 辆 Model Y 和 Model 3 汽车，占该公司全球产量的一半以上。

目前尚不清楚特斯拉在扩建工厂时是否面临任何监管障碍。

投资者也很想知道中国监管机构是否会批准特斯拉高级驾驶辅助功能的发布。这些功能在美国作为“全自动驾驶”软件的一部分提供，每辆车售价 15,000 美元。

消息人士称，预计马斯克将在本周晚些时候会见其他中国高级官员并访问上海工厂，但目前尚不清楚他具体会见谁或他们将讨论什么问题。

  • 大流行、乌克兰战争、货币风险推高成本
  • 联合利华用非洲原料替代部分进口原料
  • 转变为非洲供应商和农民创造机会

布萨里·卡萨利 (Busari Kasali) 曾经担心他的木薯——他的家乡尼日利亚的主要作物——在上市前会变质。如今，这位 76 岁的老人表示，他最关心的是跟上消费品巨头联合利华不断增长的需求。

“情况发生了变化，”卡萨利说，他的工人用卡车装载了丰收的淀粉根，这些根用于加工成牙膏。他说，过去两年他的收入几乎翻了三倍。

“我们现在想种多少就种多少……我们知道在哪里卖。”

在大流行引发的供应链中断、成本飙升和货币波动加​​剧的情况下，联合利华(ULVR.L)正在努力使其非洲业务更加自力更生，增加当地采购，部分原因是为了减少其外汇风险。

专家说，这对非洲一些地区的农民和加工商来说是一个潜在的福音。

与许多跨国公司一样，联合利华在过去两年中一直在努力应对不断上涨的能源和原材料成本。乌克兰战争加剧了从 COVID-19 大流行开始的供应链僵局和制造问题。

联合利华 - 旗下品牌包括 Knorr、Hellmann's 和 Ben & Jerry's - 去年因净材料通胀损失超过 40 亿欧元（44 亿美元）。它预计今年上半年某些商品的价格将进一步飙升。

联合利华表示，管理外汇成本在很大程度上是推动转向非洲供应商的原因，尽管从非洲大陆采购的成本可能高于从亚洲部分地区采购的成本。

许多非洲国家日益严重的债务危机给外汇储备带来了压力，并造成了货币波动，使得投入品的运输变得更加困难和昂贵。

联合利华首席业务运营和供应链官 Reginaldo Ecclissato 告诉路透社：“我们向（非洲）消费者销售的品牌中，超过 95% 是在非洲工厂生产的。”

“但是，直到最近，我们只能从非洲内部采购所需投入的三分之一以下。”

联合利华拒绝分享其在非洲的转变规模或整体经济影响的数据。

该公司表示，如今在非洲市场销售的联合利华产品中，超过三分之二的成分来自非洲大陆。

特别是，它正在加大从南非和尼日利亚等国家/地区的供应商采购山梨糖醇和香料的力度，这些产品以前是从印度和中国进口的。

联合利华并不孤单。专注于非洲的供应链顾问泰德乔治表示，包括雀巢(NESN.S)和达能(DANO.PA)在内的其他公司也在更深入地研究非洲，部分原因是其快速增长的消费市场。

他说，他们还在寻求减少对中国的依赖，以避免未来重演北京严格的大流行封锁造成的瘫痪。

雀巢没有回应对此事发表评论的请求，而达能则拒绝发表评论。

“中国正在发生的事情正在促使人们寻找替代品，”曾在 2015 年至 2018 年期间负责这家乳制品巨头非洲业务的达能前高管皮埃尔-安德烈·泰里斯 (Pierre-André Térisse) 说。

“这对非洲来说是一个机会。”

“巨大”的潜力

Ecclissato 说，虽然联合利华四年前启动了推动从非洲采购的举措，但该计划在大流行期间加速了。

例如，在南非，它开发了一个小农网络，为其当地的 Roberstons 香料品牌、Rajah 咖喱混合物和 Knorrox 肉汤块种植香菜和辣椒，以取代以前在印度采购的香料。

在尼日利亚，其拉各斯工厂每年生产 10,000 至 14,000 吨 CloseUp 和 Pepsodent 牙膏，联合利华正在加大山梨醇的本地采购力度，山梨糖醇是一种以前从中国进口的成分，可以从木薯中提取。

Yemisi Iranloye 的公司 Psaltry International 在 Oyo State 加工来自包括 Busari Kasali 在内的大约 10,000 名农民的木薯，该公司正在从这一转变中获利。

去年年底才开始向联合利华供应山梨糖醇，这家跨国公司现在购买了 Iranloye 约 70% 的山梨糖醇产量，占 Psaltry 总营业额的 40% 左右。

联合利华 (Unilever) 的 Ecclissato 表示，在当地采购可以建立更紧密的供应商合作伙伴关系、节省运输费用并减少碳足迹。重要的是，它还减少了支付进口所需的外汇。

对于像联合利华这样的公司来说，其仅在尼日利亚的业务就在 2021 年报告了 705 亿尼日利亚奈拉（1.53 亿美元）的营业额，采购这些美元的成本可能会快速增加。

Iranloye 也是雀巢和达能的供应商，她认为对冲美元短缺和当地货币波动的愿望正在刺激她所有客户的需求。她预计今年 Psaltry 的营业额将增加一倍以上。

“这也意味着非洲大陆民众，尤其是农民的生计会更好，”她说，因为在附近，机器正在清洗一批新运来的木薯。

尽管如此，尽管联合利华的规模和影响力可能使其成为非洲的一股变革力量，但一些人，如泰德乔治，认为目前尚不清楚该公司是否正在充分发挥其潜力。

“它在非洲贸易的规模上处于什么位置？它在联合利华供应链的规模上处于什么位置？”他说。 “因为它是联合利华，它们绝对是庞大的。”

非洲自身生产原材料（尤其是农产品）的能力也可能是一个限制因素，至少目前如此。

Iranloye 最近升级了她的木薯加工设施，以满足不断增长的需求，包括来自联合利华的需求。但它目前仅以大约 60% 的容量运行。

“我们的木薯仍然不够，”她说。 “原材料是一个挑战。农民需要得到适当的资助。

  • 乌克兰炮击边境城镇四人受伤-州长
  • 炼油厂火灾是对俄罗斯基础设施的最新袭击
  • 俄罗斯称美国在莫斯科无人机袭击后支持“恐怖分子”

    • 莫斯科任命的官员周三表示，乌克兰炮击在乌克兰东部卢甘斯克地区的一个村庄造成 5 人死亡，而无人机袭击导致俄罗斯南部一家炼油厂起火。

    俄罗斯官员说，乌克兰炮兵一周内第三次袭击靠近边境的俄罗斯小镇，建筑物和车辆受损，四人受伤。

    China's factory activity shrank faster than expected in May on weakening demand, heaping pressure on policymakers to shore up a patchy economic recovery and knocking Asian financial markets lower.

    The official manufacturing purchasing managers' index (PMI) fell to a five-month low of 48.8, the National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) said on Wednesday, down from 49.2 in April and below the 50-point mark that separates expansion from contraction. PMI 也打破了增长至 49.4 的预期。

    Service sector activity expanded at the slowest pace in four months in May, with the official non-manufacturing PMI falling to 54.5 from 56.4.

    The readings pushed markets in Asia into the red with the yuan and Australian and New Zealand dollars tumbling and regional stocks falling sharply.

    "The PMI data reveal that China may heading to a K-shaped recovery," said Bruce Pang, chief economist at Jones Lang LaSalle.

    "The sluggish domestic demand could weigh on China's sustainable growth, if there are no efficient and effective policy moves to engineer a broad-based recovery," said Pang.

    The PMIs also echoed weak factory data from other parts of Asia with Japan reporting a surprise decline in output and South Korean production weakening.

    The world's second-largest economy is emerging from three years of pandemic lockdowns, but the recovery has been uneven with services spending outperforming activity in the factory, property and export-oriented sectors.

    The PMI subindexes for May showed factory output swung to contraction from an expansion while new orders, including new exports, fell for the second month.

    Chemical, ferrous metal smelting and rolling processing industries faced significant declines in production and demand, said NBS.

    In the services sector, rail and air transport, accommodation and catering sectors remained in the expansion, on the back of strong May Labor Day travel, while real estate activity fell.

    LOSING MOMENTUM

    4 月份的采购经理人指数和其他经济指标进一步证明反弹正在失去动力。

    Last month, imports contracted sharply, factory gate prices fell, property investment slumped, industrial profits plunged and factory output and retail sales both missed forecasts.

    Analysts are now downgrading their expectations for the economy with Nomura and Barclays both cutting China's 2023 GDP growth forecasts.

    "Proactive fiscal policies, rate cuts or RRR cuts and targeted monetary policy tools together with structural reform would be key," Jones Lang LaSalle's Pang added.

    A North Korean satellite launch on Wednesday ended in failure, sending the booster and payload plunging into the sea, North Korean state media said, and the South's military said it had recovered parts of the launch vehicle.

    The new "Chollima-1" satellite launch rocket failed because of instability in the engine and fuel system, state news agency KCNA reported.

    The flight was the nuclear-armed state's sixth satellite launch attempt, and the first since 2016. It was supposed to put North Korea's first spy satellite in orbit.

    It prompted emergency alerts and brief evacuation warnings in parts of South Korea and Japan. The notices were withdrawn with no danger or damage reported.

    South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff said on Wednesday the military was conducting a salvage operation to recover what is believed to be parts of the space launch vehicle.

    The military shared pictures of debris pulled from the water, including a large cylindrical object tethered to a buoy.

    George William Herbert, adjunct professor at the Center for Nonproliferation Studies and a missile consultant, said the images showed at least part of a rocket, including an "interstage" section designed to connect to another stage.

    It is most likely a liquid-fuel rocket, and a round, brown object inside is likely a propellant tank for either fuel or oxidizer, Herbert added.

    Officials from the United States, Japan, South Korea held a phone call, where they “strongly condemned" the launch, Japan's foreign ministry said.

    “The three countries will stay vigilant with high sense of urgency”, the statement said.

    North Korea had said it would launch its first military reconnaissance satellite between May 31 and June 11 to boost monitoring of US military activities.

    South Korea last week placed satellites in orbit with a domestically designed and produced rocket for the first time, and China sent three astronauts to its space station as part of crew rotation on Tuesday.

    The rocket plunged into the sea "after losing thrust due to the abnormal starting of the second-stage engine," KCNA reported, in an unusually candid admission of a technical failure by the North.

    Pyongyang's National Aerospace Development Administration (NADA) will investigate the "serious defects" and take action to overcome them before conducting a second launch as soon as possible, KCNA said.

    Lee Choon Geun, honorary research fellow at South Korea's Science and Technology Policy Institute, said it was a rare opportunity for South Korea to retrieve part of a North Korean rocket, and perhaps even the satellite. He played down the prospect of another imminent launch, noting it might take the North several months to fix the technical issue.

    In data provided to international authorities before the launch, North Korea said the rocket would fly south, with stages and other debris expected to fall over the Yellow Sea and into the Pacific Ocean.

    Air raid sirens wailed across the South Korean capital of Seoul about 6:32 am (2132 GMT Tuesday) as the city warned citizens to prepare for a potential evacuation. Later alerts said the city warning had been a mistake.

    "I was so panicked . Nine-one-one lines were busy and the internet was slow," said Lee Juyeon, 33, a resident in the city of 9 million who was preparing to shelter in a basement with her young child before learning it was a false alarm.

    On Tuesday, Ri Pyong Chol, vice-chairman of the Central Military Commission of North Korea's ruling Workers' Party, said ongoing joint military exercises by the US and South Korea required Pyongyang to have the "means capable of gathering information about the military acts of the enemy in real time."

    The White House condemned a launch using ballistic missile technology and said in a statement it was assessing the situation in coordination with allies.

    Japan's Chief Cabinet Secretary Hirokazu Matsuno said North Korea's rocket disappeared from radar above the Yellow Sea and did not make it into space, and added the government had no further information to share now.

    "We strongly condemn North Korea's actions," he said. Tokyo lodged a complaint to Pyongyang through diplomatic channels in Beijing, he said.

    UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres also condemned the satellite launch, a spokesperson said.

    He said any launch by Pyongyang using ballistic missile technology was contrary to UN Security Council resolutions.

    North Korea has attempted five other satellite launches, with two placed in orbit, including during its last such launch in 2016. Its capacity for constructing working satellites remains unproven, however, analysts say.

    The Reserve Bank of Australia will not sign any new contracts with PricewaterhouseCoopers (PwC) Australia until a scandal over the firm's misuse of confidential government tax plans is sorted out, the central bank's governor said on Wednesday.

    The "big four" firm is on the defense after a former Australian tax partner who was consulting with the government on laws to prevent corporate tax avoidance shared confidential drafts with colleagues to drum up business around the world.

    It faces missing out on lucrative Australian government contracts as a growing chorus of politicians, ministers and officials call for PwC to be blacklisted until it satisfactorily responds to the scandal.

    As of May 16, the government had committed to contracts worth A$255 million ($173 million) with PwC in the current financial year alone, a finance department official told a parliamentary hearing last week.

    Reserve Bank of Australia (RBA) Governor Philip Lowe told senators on Wednesday he was "appalled" by the breach and the RBA would not line up PwC for any work until the bank was satisfied the issue had been resolved.

    "(We) have taken the decision to enter no new contracts with PwC until a satisfactory response has been forthcoming," Lowe said.

    "A satisfactory response includes both complete transparency and accountability for those involved."

    Australian Prudential Regulation Authority (APRA) chair John Lonsdale told the hearing ethics would be a "key factor" in any future procurement. The authority has one contract with PwC expiring in about two weeks, he said.

    APRA had also spoken with major Australian banks about their ties to PwC, as recently as last week, added Lonsdale.

    "If you're dealing with an entity with ethical issues there are prudential, reputational standing issues," he said.

    His comments came a day after Treasury Secretary Steven Kennedy said the breach was "clearly disturbing" and the department would review a PwC audit contract worth almost A$1 million that expires this year.

    The firm's acting CEO Kristin Stubbins, who took the job after her predecessor resigned earlier this month, on Monday apologised in an open letter and said nine unnamed partners had been directed to take leave.

    PwC has said it would not comment on the hearings beyond the statement issued on Monday.
